Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.9620615] Gram positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=50 μg/ml), Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=25 μg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=100 μg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=12.5 μg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=6-12.5 μg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=12.5 μg/ml), Streptococcus faecalis (MIC=25 μg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=3 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=100 μg/ml), Pasteurella multocida (MIC=100 μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Maculatin-1.1 shows significant antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria, less against Gram-negative bacteria. Maculatin-1.1.1 is inactive.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: The maculatin peptide from the skin glands of the tree frog Litoria genimaculata a comparison of the structures and antibacterial activities of maculatin 1.1 and caerin 1.1
Literature.Author: Rozek T, Waugh RJ, Steinborner ST, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Wallace JC.

Literature.Title: The maculatin peptides from the skin glands of the tree frog Litoria genimaculata. A comparison of the structures and antibacterial activities of maculatin 1.1 and caerin 1.1.
Literature.Author: Tyler M.J.,Bowie J.H.,Steinborner S.T.,Waugh R.J.,Rozek T.
